subject: Design
subcategory: Design Disasters and What They Teach Us
title: Gap's Logo Disaster: Six Days of Internet Fury
description: Learn Gap's Logo Disaster: Six Days of Internet Fury in one minute.

hook.text: In 2010, Gap replaced its iconic blue box logo. The internet exploded with rage within hours.

buildup.text: The new logo used Helvetica with a tiny gradient square. Customers called it generic and soulless.

discovery.text: After six days of relentless mockery and parody logos flooding social media, Gap reverted to the original.

twist.text: Gap never revealed the redesign cost, but industry estimates put it at $100 million including rollout plans.

climax.text: The Gap logo disaster proved that brand identity belongs to customers, not boardrooms.

punchline.text: Six days proved that customers own your brand. Not you.

quiz.question: How long did Gap's controversial new logo last?
